intro: Zanthoxylum chiloperone var. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into red, fleshy berries. Its bark and leaves contain compounds that have been used in traditional medicine. The species is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in woodland and chaparral habitats.
